page.title: 05HOUSING
page.content: Crosshill mainly consists of stone built, single-storey,terraced cottages, built for weavers who came from Ireland at beginning of century. Many have large gardens at the rear. The houses are mostly owner-occupied. Larger two-storey houses were, in the past,shops with houses over.The manse and school house are detached stone villas. Council houses were built post war and have been modernised. Modern bungalows have recently been built privately. Kirkmichael has 3 kinds of housing.There are about 80 cottage type houses,130 years old.Post 1945,40 Council houses were built at the south end of the village,half of which are wooden.Mid 1970 a private housing estate was developed in the centre of the village.These had to resemble the old cottage style as Kirkmichael is a conservation village.
